07/22/content_8456302.htm Pseudo models steal focus at book fair]. China Daily
(HK Edition)  are young models with no training and who do not possess the
physical qualities required of high fashion catwalk models, which usually
include a minimum height of 5'9". "Young and pretty not enough to
launch a career, top models say", South China Morning Post, 17 July 2009.
Lang mo models arose to prominence in Hong Kong in the late 2000s.

Lang mos often work as promotional models at fairs and expositions. They often
attract publicity by welcoming photos of them being taken in skimpy outfits,
such as bikinis. "[http://news.sina.com.hk/cgi-
bin/nw/show.cgi/16/1/1/1203901/1.html oéæ¨¡ä¹äºãçæå ]." Sina.com.hk Retrieved on 21
December 2009. Many have published their own albums of photographs.
